page.title: 09A Typical Small Farm
page.content: One small farm we visited had cut down on fields because they had finished dairy farming. Most of their land is used for grazing. They also grow some barley and wheat. Like other farmers they now buy calves at one week old, when really the calves should still be feeding off their mothers. They do not use artificial fertilizer because they prefer natural hay. It smells nicer and has a green tinge. They have enough good grazing land for their cows and if they wanted they could grow crops there. They do not make silage because the farm is too small. On a small farm they do not have to rush, because they do not have as much to do. Their pace of life seems fairly slow.
